Name: Desert Warthog
Location: Eastern Africa, primarily in Kenya and Somalia
Details: The desert warthog (Phacochoerus aethiopicus) is characterized by its large tusks and distinctive facial warts. They inhabit arid and semi-arid regions and are well adapted to these harsh environments.

Name: Duroc Pig
Location: Worldwide, originally from the United States
Details: Duroc pigs are red in color, known for their excellent growth rate and feed efficiency. They have a calm disposition and are often used in crossbreeding for meat production.

Name: Hampshire Pig
Location: Worldwide, originally from the United States
Details: Duroc pigs are red in color, known for their excellent growth rate and feed efficiency. They have a calm disposition and are often used in crossbreeding for meat production.

Name: Oxford Sandy and Black
Details: The Oxford Sandy and Black, also known as the Plum Pudding Pig, is one of the oldest British pig breeds. They are sandy-colored with black patches.

Name: Red River Hog
Details: The red river hog (Potamochoerus porcus) is a colorful wild pig with a reddish coat, black legs, and distinctive white markings on the face and back.

Name: Togian Babirusa
Details: The Togian babirusa (Babyrousa togeanensis) is a wild pig species known for its distinctive tusks, which can grow upwards and even penetrate the skin

Name: Warthog
Details: The warthog (Phacochoerus africanus) is known for its large tusks and facial warts. They inhabit savannas, grasslands, and woodlands

Name: Wild Boar
Location: Europe, Asia, and North Africa; introduced to other regions worldwide
Details: The wild boar (Sus scrofa) has a bristly coat, prominent tusks, and a robust body. They are highly adaptable and inhabit forests, grasslands, and agricultural areas.
